parts: In HTML, how do I specify the color of a short snippet of text?

To specify the color of a short snippet of text in HTML, you can use the `` tag combined with the `style` attribute. Here’s an example of how to do it: ```html This text is blue. ``` You can replace `"blue"` with any valid CSS color value, such as a color name, a hex code (`#ff0000`), an RGB value (`rgb(255, 0, 0)`), or an HSL value (`hsl(0, 100%, 50%)`). Example with hex code: ```html This text is red. ``` This method works well for styling small portions of text within a larger block of HTML content.
